subject: Add IPMB based support to read firmware versions.
commitMessage:
Add IPMB based support to read firmware versions.

Added support to read firmware versions (CPLD, ME, BIC, VR) and it
creates multiple dbus objpath for each IPMB bus and OEM specified
netfunction & command is used and these firmware versions can be
used to check the version of CPLD, ME, BIC, VR once firmware
update is completed.

Number of IPMB bus index can be identified using OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES
which is enabled in machine layer.

Added a new JSON file in entity-manager to define the properties of
twinlake firmware version for the multihost. From the EM file,
deviceAddress, bus and pollRate of each version can also be
configured.

Device Address represents the version Address and bus represents the
host number. Version will be updated with the pollrate of 10 mins and
it will be displayed using busctl command.

TESTED: Tested on Facebook YosemiteV2 hardware.
Verified all the host firmware versions.

Version Format:

busctl call xyz.openbmc_project.Ipmi.Channel.Ipmb
/xyz/openbmc_project/Ipmi/Channel/Ipmb org.openbmc.Ipmb sendRequest
yyyyay 0 0x38 0 0x0b 4 0x15 0xa0 0 2

Bus           - 0
Netfn         - 0x38
Lun           - 0
Command       - 0x0b
Command Data  - 0x15 0xa0 0 2(DeviceAddress)

Response : (iyyyyay) 0 57 0 11 0 5 21 160 0 1 33
IANA    - 21 160 0
version - 1 33 (1.33)

root@yosemitev2:~# busctl introspect xyz.openbmc_project.IpmbSensor /xyz/openbmc_project/software/version/3_Bridge_IC
NAME                                 TYPE      SIGNATURE RESULT/VALUE FLAGS
org.freedesktop.DBus.Introspectable  interface -         -            -
.Introspect                          method    -         s            -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Peer            interface -         -            -
.GetMachineId                        method    -         s            -
.Ping                                method    -         -            -
org.freedesktop.DBus.Properties      interface -         -            -
.Get                                 method    ss        v            -
.GetAll                              method    s         a{sv}        -
.Set                                 method    ssv       -            -
.PropertiesChanged                   signal    sa{sv}as  -            -
xyz.openbmc_project.Software.Version interface -         -            -
.Version                             property  s         "1.33"       emits-change writable

Signed-off-by: Jayashree Dhanapal <jayashree-d@hcl.com>
Change-Id: I07143ba949edcefb3d1d9a9148b5dccaae5a86c1

Patch Set 15:

(7 comments)

Apologies for avoiding this.  I was having trouble wrapping my head around what it was trying to accomplish.  Now that I understand (I think) I suspect it needs a little bit of refactoring.  Considering this is in no way a sensor, it shouldn't be dragging all the sensor interfaces and code along with it.  I would really expect this to be a new class, and a new Exposes type (not a subtype).  If that means we need to generisize some of the IPMB sensor interfaces into a "call generic IPMB command" type method, that seems worthwhile to keep a design that's maintainable in the long run.

As written, I don't see this "add all IPMB things to the IPMB sensor class" scaling cleanly beyond this commit.

With that said, in concept this looks good.  Lets see if we can get this refactored a little bit and it should be good to go.
Topic set to Firmware Version

Set Work In Progress

Hi!

Can you use your full name here? 
From https://github.com/openbmc/docs/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#formatting-commit-messages

"All commit messages must include a "Signed-off-by" line, which indicates that you the contributor have agreed to the Developer Certificate of Origin (see below). This line must include the full name you commonly use, often a given name and a family name or surname. (ok: Sam Samuelsson, Robert A. Heinlein; not ok: xXthorXx, Sam, RAH)"

Thanks!
Done
Why are we calling into OEM commands in a generic (non-oem) daemon?  Shouldn't this be calling into get device ID?

Since firmware version netFn and cmd is oem specific, I added this namespace here.
Can we hardcode this value under IpmbType for version?
please provide your suggestion.
Is this something need to be polled every second? If not, need to modify when it will be read per requirement
Sure, I will work on this.
naming convention
Done
Is the expected data format documented somewhere?
It is based on OEM specified documentation.

Is this documentation public? Either add a pointer to the public documentation in commit message or add a comment here in the code the expected format of the data. Hard coded magic number like 3 here is not recommended normally.
First 3 bytes of data will be IANA, so it is ignored. I will add a comments in the code.
combine
Done
This seems nowhere near the level of detail needed for this level of feature.
Done
Presumably the json file is in an EM commit.  Can you put them both under the same topic please.
What is a multihost?
Done
We are testing features in OCP YosemiteV2 target which has 4 removable host that can be plugged in to YV2 slots (multihost).

This is better, but still needs more details.  What OEM commands?  What device implements these for your system?  How are these OEM commands invoked from the config file (those details might also be in your EM commit).

When these are translated, what versions exist?  Why are these important?  Where are the OEM commands for these things defined?  If they're not defined anywhere outside of this, a basic prototype of their usage would be good.  You somewhat tried to do that in the "Version Format" section below, but more detail there would be good to add for others trying to add their own flavor of OEM ipmi commands.
Sure, I will update more details in upcoming patchset.
this name is confusing, what does it represent? Seems like it is associated with "Bus" from config.

It represents the host number of yv2 and it will be varied based on which host we are validating.
host 1 - 0 (index), host 2 - 4, host 3 - 8, host 4 - 12

I updated "index" as "hostNum".
this the same as line 86, move before if()
Here, I am using versionPathPrefix (/xyz/openbmc_project/software/) instead of sensorPathPrefix  (/xyz/openbmc_project/sensors/), dbus path will be varied for version.
why is subtype needed?
I removed this in the latest code.
This looks strange: version will be "byte3.byte4.byte5.byte6byte7.byte8...bytelast". Is that correct?

yes, you are correct. 
Please suggest if there is any way to optimize this part.
I would just add a comment for why no "." between byte6 and byte7, which is the strange part for me

Intel® ME FW version as per Intel Spec. The full version number has the following format:
“[Major].[Minor].[ABC].[PATCH]”
[Major] – Major FW Revision
[Minor]. – Minor FW revision
[ABC]– Firmware build number
[PATCH] – patch number
where,
[C] and [PATCH] are combined, so there is no "." between byte6 and byte7.
no need, use pollTimeValue directly
Done
use type != Version makes more sense to me.
Done
Why is this needed if it is going to always be set to "version"
I removed this in the updated code.
Can you add some comments (and update the namespace) so it's clear that these are OEM commands for twin lake only?  (or maybe it's OCP boards only?)
Sure, I will update this in the latest code.

This feels a little messy.  Considering that these new things:
1. Aren't sensors
2. Don't need 90% of the information or methods in this class

I kinda suspect we need a new class for "IPMB Version" types, rather than just continue to extend ipmb sensor.
I will work on updating the code which are related to firmware version in new class.
Maybe something bit more generic then "Version"? Like "Info" or "Parameter".

My initial feedback was whether it fits better with software management daemon. Then I lost track of that thought.
Are these versions tied to inventory items? IS BMC responsible for updating them?

> My initial feedback was whether it fits better with software management daemon. Then I lost track of that thought.

Not really.  The existing software management daemons aren't really meant for this, and definitely don't support EM configurations today.  In theory, this is publishing the same interface.

> Are these versions tied to inventory items?

Considering that they're being generated from an EM config (or they will be) yes, they'd be associated.

> IS BMC responsible for updating them?
Pretty sure not at this point in time, but that's a discussion to have for a later patchset, if we really can support IPMB firmware update (which I don't think we can).
Ah - make sense. Thanks for pointing out the obvious(smile). So yes, a different class, but same daemon/service.
This is also going to expose non-sensical sensor values.  See above, I suspect this needs its own class.
sure, I will work on this.
If we're adding PollRate to this sensor, that should be its own commit.
Ack
Adding a brief description about the purpose this class can be good.
Ack
can we print error log to inform if we have an error.
Done
condition to check if data is not empty will be good.
Done
use name "index" instead of i.
Done
What is EM file?

This is Entity Manager configuration file where the properties required for IPMB version are defined.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/entity-manager/+/39319
Please don't use magic numbers. Use constexpr or Macro's
Ack

Suggest not to use the hardcoded string. Use some meaningful variables.
Same comment applies for all the hardcoded strings in this patch
Done
Magic number
Done
Suggest to add comments to understand the why index starts with 3 and how you parsed the version ?
Done
Suggest to Validate the version value red from ipmb
Version can be validated only by checking whether the data is empty or not and it is already checked in the above code.
It will be good to validate the expected hostNum's. Need to handle if config has incorrect host num ?
Enabled OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES in machine layer and received in meson build, this will verify the number of IPMB bus in BMC.
Use '-', Same comment as in meson_options.txt
Fixed in latest patchset.
use '-' instead of '_' like other options.
Fixed in latest patchset.
Put in its own header please.
Ack
This should be coming from entity-manager configuration, not a compile time config.

Entity manager config will provide single instance, this OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES is coming from dbus-sensors bb file and it will represent the host instances of each platform to validate the value coming from entity-manager config.
since utils.hpp has these headers included already, remove these header inclusions here.
Ack
Please don't put code for a class called "IpmbVersion" in a file for "IpmbSensor"
IpmbFWVersion is a much suitable name for this class.

Ack, Whether the common code for FWversion & sensor needs to be refactored and put in a separate file like IpmbMain.cpp and other codes in separate file such as IpmbSensor.cpp, IpmbFWVersion.cpp 
(or)
only IpmbFWVersion code needs to be moved to another file by creating new service and not disturbing the existing file IpmbSensor.cpp ?
I have created IpmbFWVersion.cpp file and it will have version constructor and related functions. This will be called from IpmbSensor.cpp file.
Done

Is this part of code handled in case of other platforms. It is better that we display error  and skip to idle 
state instead of throwing and stopping the execution for false condition.
It is handled in the earlier part of the code.
this method name can be just read() as the class name contains version
Done
Unaddressed comment.  Version needs to be pulling from its own type, not reusing the subtype of the sensor based one.
Ack
versions.emplace()?
Ack
This error needs handled earlier.  If we hit this case, the IpmbVersion object has still been constructed and is now empty.
Ack
The other classes call this "init()".  lets be consistent.
Ack
These header inclusions can be removed as it is there in utils.hpp file
Ack
Once you're reading from the entity-manager config, I suspect both of these will go away.

I am reading host index from entity manager config only, these two functions is to validate the host index value which is getting from the config file.

OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES will have the host instances for each platform. 
Ex: OBMC_HOST_INSTANCES = 1 2 3 4

While reading value as 4 from entity-manager config, it will check whether the value is present in these instances.
Instead hardcoding, can we use constexpr string for this interface name ?
Done
do we need to throw here?
I referred this from sensor interface initialize and throw is not mentioned there.
incrementError??
Done
incrementError??
Done
What are we doing here?

Converting uint8_t data to string and appending the bytes using dot. After last byte, there should be no dot and for ME version, byte 6 and byte 7 of data should be combined, so there is no dot between them.
Can you write a code comment for this function so that it is easy for the reader?

Make the return type clear by mentioning std::vector<std::string>
or use std::optional<std::vector<std::string>>
Done
Done
Make this const expression
Removed this variable and used directly in find().
Or use " " directly here
Done

nit:
You can use std::istringstream and std::getline to split the string using a delimiter.
I received a comment that stringstream is not efficient and asked me use 'find' and 'substr'.
Can you write a code comment for this function so that it is easy for the reader?
Done
